decks.notes: This deck focuses on a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing cards that can deal damage quickly and efficiently. It takes advantage of sacrificing creatures for various effects, such as drawing cards or dealing damage to the opponent. The key strategy involves using cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Witch's Oven to control the board while pushing damage through with creatures like Dreadhorde Butcher and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger. Additionally, the deck utilizes the companion Lurrus of the Dream-Den to provide additional value and resilience in the late game.

This control deck aims to stall the opponent's board with counterspells, removal, and board wipes while generating card advantage with Narset and Yorion. Fires of Invention allows for powerful plays without using mana, and Lukka can cheat in expensive threats like Agent of Treachery. The deck focuses on tempo and card advantage, with a strong late game when it can start stealing the opponent's creatures. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistency in casting spells and activating abilities. The goal is to outvalue the opponent and control the game until victory.

The deck focuses on aggressively cycling through cards to build up resources and overwhelm opponents with quick, efficient attacks. The aim is to efficiently use cycling abilities to draw cards and gain advantages, fueling powerful cards like Zenith Flare to deal damage based on the amount of cards cycled. The deck also includes cards that allow for efficient removal and protection, making it a versatile and aggressive deck that can quickly close out games.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using cards like Narset, Teferi, and Shark Typhoon to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Fires of Invention allows you to cast spells for free, while Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast and Agent of Treachery provide powerful creature-stealing threats. The deck also includes a companion, Yorion, Sky Nomad, to provide additional value by blinking permanents for extra benefits. With a mix of removal, card draw, and powerful threats, this control deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing the Fires of Invention enchantment, which allows you to cast spells for free but limits you to two spells per turn. The deck includes powerful control cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Deafening Clarion to maintain control of the board. Additionally, the deck includes Keruga, the Macrosage as a companion, allowing you to draw cards and keep your hand full. The deck also includes creatures like Kenrith, the Returned King and Cavalier of Flame for additional board presence and threats.

This mono black aggro deck focuses on leveraging the odd converted mana costs of its creatures to take advantage of Obosh, the Preypiercer's ability to deal extra damage. By including only odd-costed creatures and using cards like Whisper Squad and Heraldic Banner to generate additional creatures and mana, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den allows for the potential to recur key creatures from the graveyard, further increasing the deck's resilience and versatility.

Utilizing a graveyard-focused aggression, this Rakdos Aggro deck aims to rapidly sacrifice and recur creatures for continuous board presence and chip away at the opponent's life total. Key components include Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion, alongside synergies with Cauldron Familiar, Witch's Oven, and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger. The deck aims to generate value through efficient sacrificing and attacking strategies, utilizing a mix of early-game pressure and mid-game recursion to overwhelm opponents and secure victories.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing cards like Wilderness Reclamation and Shark Typhoon to generate advantage over the opponent. By ramping with Growth Spiral and Fabled Passage, the deck aims to cast powerful spells like Expansion / Explosion and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck also includes counterspells like Mystical Dispute and Thassa's Intervention to stop opposing threats. Overall, the goal is to outvalue the opponent and eventually win through card advantage and efficient control of the board.

The deck focuses on generating value through ramp and card advantage while controlling the board with various removal spells and counters. It aims to outvalue the opponent with cards like Yorion, Genesis Ultimatum, and Agent of Treachery, while also utilizing creatures like Risen Reef and Cavalier of Thorns to generate additional card advantage. The deck also has access to a variety of lands to ensure consistent mana fixing and smooth gameplay.

The central strategy of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers. The deck aims to stall the game through card draw and removal until it can stabilize and eventually take over the game with powerful threats like Yorion, Sky Nomad and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. By utilizing powerful cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Elspeth Conquers Death, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and outlast them in the late game.

The deck focuses on utilizing cycling cards to quickly cycle through the deck and build up resources to play cards like Zenith Flare, which deals damage based on the number of cards cycled. The strategy revolves around dealing damage quickly and efficiently by cycling cards like Boon of the Wish-Giver and Frostveil Ambush, while using cards like Valiant Rescuer and Flourishing Fox to create additional threats on the board. With Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion, this aggro-cycling deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a stream of low-cost, high impact plays.

This deck focuses on using Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, while controlling the board with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Deafening Clarion. The deck also includes creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Cavalier of Flame to apply pressure, as well as Kenrith, the Returned King for its versatile abilities. The inclusion of Sphinx of Foresight allows for card selection and helps set up the strategy. Overall, the deck aims to establish control early on and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful spells and creatures.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast spells without mana cost. The goal is to control the board with cards like Agent of Treachery and Shatter the Sky, while generating value with cards like Shark Typhoon and Elspeth Conquers Death. The addition of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value by blinking permanents. The deck aims to efficiently control the game and generate card advantage through powerful control spells and card draw engines.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on sacrificing creatures for value, gaining incremental advantage through effects triggered by sacrificing creatures such as Witch's Oven, Priest of Forgotten Gods, and Mayhem Devil. The synergy between cards like Cruel Celebrant, Cauldron Familiar, and Woe Strider allows for constant pressure on the opponent while generating value from sacrificing creatures. The deck also includes cards like Midnight Reaper and Fiend Artisan for card advantage and flexibility in play. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient sacrifice outlets.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on dealing damage quickly and efficiently to overwhelm opponents. It utilizes cards like Mayhem Devil, Judith, the Scourge Diva, and Obosh, the Preypiercer to maximize damage output. The deck also incorporates graveyard recursion with Lurrus of the Dream-Den and Woe Strider, as well as sacrificing creatures for additional benefits with Cauldron Familiar and Witch's Oven. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to maintain a steady stream of aggression to pressure opponents and secure victory.

The primary focus of this deck is to put early pressure on the opponent with efficient and aggressive creatures like Bonecrusher Giant, Anax, Hardened in the Forge, and Robber of the Rich. The deck aims to quickly build a board presence and finish off the opponent with burn spells like Shock and Embercleave. Torbran, Thane of Red Fell boosts the damage output of all our red sources, while cards like Runaway Steam-Kin help to ramp up our mana. This deck aims to win the game quickly by overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells.
